flawed_nl_solution:
Mr. Salazar had 7 x 12 = <<7*12=84>>84 oranges.
He reserved 84 x 1/4 = <<84*1/4=21>>21 oranges for his friend.
Ha had 84 - 21 = <<84-21=63>>63 oranges to be sold yesterday.
But only 63 x 3/7 = <<63*3/7=72>>72 oranges were sold yesterday.
So, he had 63 - 72 = <<63-72=-9>>-9 oranges left.
Since four oranges are rotten, then only -9 - 4 = <<-9-4=-13>>-13 oranges are left to be sold today.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 27, not 72. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
